tool.name: SAGA.pointcloud_tools.13
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayTAB_IN False isArrayFIELD_X False isArrayFIELD_Y False isArrayFIELD_Z False isArrayFIELDS False output_data_PC_OUT $output_data_PC_OUT name SAGA.pointcloud_tools.13 TAB_IN $TAB_IN FIELD_X $FIELD_X FIELD_Y $FIELD_Y FIELD_Z $FIELD_Z FIELDS $FIELDS prefer $prefer response $response outputType_PC_OUT $OutputSection_PC_OUT.outputType_PC_OUT transmissionMode_PC_OUT $OutputSection_PC_OUT.transmissionMode_PC_OUT

param.name: TAB_IN
param.label: Table
param.help: The input table. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: FIELD_X
param.label: X
param.help: The attribute field with the x-coordinate. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: FIELD_Y
param.label: Y
param.help: The attribute field with the y-coordinate. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: FIELD_Z
param.label: Z
param.help: The attribute field with the z-coordinate. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: FIELDS
param.label: Attributes
param.help: The attribute fields to convert, optional. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_PC_OUT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_PC_OUT
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This tool allows one to create a point cloud from a table.<br/><br/>
